channel.description: Recent content in Daciana Draghia on

item.title: REST API aplication on Google Cloud Platform
item.description: The project presents a REST API aplication developed in Python and Flask that was created to retrieve data about books from a SQLite3 database: https://github.com/cpatrickalves/simple-flask-api A REST API exposes the functionalities of an application or a database through a set of endpoints (URL addresses). These URLs are accessed by clients such as web, mobile apps, or other web services to perform CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) or other actions using HTTP requests.

item.title: Fingerprint recognition, Python, Tkinter
item.description: A biometric fingerprint recognition system is organized into four main stages: fingerprint input, feature extraction of fingerprints, comparison stage with the fingerprint set from the database (1:N type comparisons), and the final stage of deciding whether there is a match with a record in the dataset. link to the project on github The following figure shows the logical scheme and structure of the project. It also illustrates the addition of a new fingerprint to the database and the deletion of a record.

item.title: Tutorial - static website with Hugo and Github pages
item.description: This tutorial will help you build and host your static website. link to the video on youtube Install powershell 7 on a windows system Check the version of PowerShell you have on your system, open PowerShell and type $PSVersionTable.PSVersion To install PowerShell 7 on your system using Winget type the following command t winget install –id Microsoft.Powershell –source winget Install Visual studio code Install Go Setup a github account and github desktop Installing Hugo using Chocolatey Chocolatey is a popular package manager for Windows that simplifies the installation of software and manages dependencies neatly.

item.title: Power BI: extracting values
item.description: Question to be answered in this project: How many kids do married people have in average in our dataset? I cleaned the data first using the following tools /steps in Power BI: o Remove Top Rows o First row as a header o Changing column names o Removing invalid rows o Setting up the data types (replace values if necessary)
